intro: Parnassia faberi f. ramosa, commonly known as the fragrant mountain buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers with prominent yellow centers and numerous stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain meadows and forest understories. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the stems are often hairy. It is native to regions in Asia, including China, where it thrives in cool, humid climates.
